FACTS MATTER 

Between 1 and 14 July, the SMM confirmed that 3 civilians were killed and 13 were in- jured.

This brings the total number of civilian casualties since 1 January 2019 to 81 (10 deaths and 71 injuries).



The SMM observed damage caused by small-arms fire and shelling to civilian property and infrastructure in numerous locations along the contact line, including to a day clinic, a power station, residential homes and functioning schools.

One school in Zolote, which was hit by gunfire, has sustained damage 11 times since the start of the year.



The SMM recorded over 14,000 ceasefire violations (compared with about 14,350 in the previous two-week period).

In the Zolote disengagement area, where the Mission noted the continued presence of forces and hardware, the number of ceasefire violations re- mained high.

No ceasefire violations were recorded in the Stanytsia Luhanska disen- gagement area since the Mission noted the disengagement of forces and hardware from the area on 26 June.



The Mission observed 119 weapons in violation of the agreed withdrawal lines (109 in areas not controlled by the Government);

and

mines and unexploded ordnance, includ- ing over 1,000 freshly-laid anti-tank mines near Veselohorivka.



On two occasions, small-arms fire occurred close to the SMM near the Zolote disengage-ment area;

on both occasions, bullets flew over the heads of SMM patrol members.



In addition to restrictions posed by mines, UXO and crossfire, the SMM’s freedom of movement was restricted 4 times in government-controlled areas and 39 times in non- government-controlled areas.



SMM unmanned aerial vehicles (UAV) were targeted by small-arms fire on four occa- sions, and subjected to signal interference, assessed as jamming, on an almost daily basis.

Twenty two of 25 mini-UAV flights conducted to search for a long-range UAV lost on 27 June near Zaichenko experienced GPS signal interference.

One SMM mini-UAV was lost while flying over Khreshchatytske.



On 17 July, the Trilateral Contact Group, with the participation of representatives of certain areas of Donetsk and Luhansk regions, re-affirmed its full commitment to a com- prehensive, sustainable and unlimited ceasefire to start at 00:01 on 21 July.
